page.title: 16Great Pineham Farm
page.content: Owned by same family (the Husk's) since 1923. Dates back to Roman times and is built on the Dover to Richborough Roman Road. It has 170 acres, half for grazing, half arable. Grows wheat and barley in winter and oats in spring. There is pasture for fattening beef cattle, the main herd being 40 "Simmental" breed from W.Germany and some Jersey cows. Sheep are kept in winter, bought from Ashford market in each autumn and sold next spring after lambing. Most of the farm machinery is hired, Mr Husk owns a fork-lift truck, convertable to a digger and he has 2 field tractors.
